Simulate Longitudinal Panel Data for Causal Inference

Source: R/margot_simulate.R
margot_simulate.Rd

Generates synthetic longitudinal panel data with flexible options for treatment assignment, outcome generation, censoring, and missing data patterns. Useful for testing causal inference methods and teaching.

Usage

margot_simulate(
  n = 500,
  waves = 3,
  p_covars = 1,
  censoring = list(rate = 0.2, exposure_dependence = FALSE, latent_dependence = FALSE,
    latent_rho = 0.5),
  item_missing_rate = 0,
  positivity = c("good", "edge", "violated"),
  exposure_outcome = 0.6,
  covar_feedback = 0,
  y_feedback = 0,
  outcome_type = c("binary", "continuous"),
  wide = FALSE,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

n

Integer. Number of individuals (default: 500).

waves

Integer. Number of measurement waves (1-20, default: 3).

p_covars

Integer. Number of time-varying covariates (default: 1).

censoring

List with components:

rate

Baseline censoring rate (default: 0.2)

exposure_dependence

Logical. Does censoring depend on prior exposure? (default: FALSE)

latent_dependence

Logical. Does censoring depend on latent factor? (default: FALSE)

latent_rho

Correlation with latent factor if latent_dependence = TRUE (default: 0.5)

item_missing_rate

Numeric. MCAR rate for covariates (0-1, default: 0).

positivity

Character. Positivity assumption scenario:

"good"

Well-behaved propensity scores

"edge"

Near-violation of positivity

"violated"

Deterministic treatment assignment

exposure_outcome

Numeric. Effect of treatment on outcome (default: 0.6).

covar_feedback

Numeric. Effect of treatment on future covariates (default: 0).

y_feedback

Numeric. Effect of previous outcome on next treatment (default: 0).

outcome_type

Character. Type of outcome variable ("binary" or "continuous").

wide

Logical. Return wide format if TRUE, long format if FALSE (default: FALSE).

seed

Integer. Random seed for reproducibility (default: NULL).

Value

A tibble with simulated data. Format depends on wide parameter:

Wide format

Columns: id, t0_l*, t0_y, t0_a, t1_l*, t1_y, t1_a, ..., y

Long format

Columns: id, wave, l1...lp, y, a, y_end

In long format, y_end contains the final outcome (non-NA only at the last observed wave for each individual).

Details

The simulation generates:

  • A latent baseline factor u affecting treatment and outcomes

  • Time-varying covariates with optional AR(1) structure

  • Treatment assignment based on covariates and latent factor

  • Outcomes influenced by treatment, covariates, and latent factor

  • Censoring patterns (MCAR or dependent on covariates/treatment)

Examples

# basic simulation with default settings
dat <- margot_simulate(n = 200, waves = 3, seed = 123)

# simulate with treatment feedback and edge positivity
dat_complex <- margot_simulate(
  n = 500, 
  waves = 4,
  p_covars = 2,
  positivity = "edge",
  y_feedback = 0.5,
  covar_feedback = 0.3,
  wide = TRUE,
  seed = 2025
)

# simulate with censoring dependent on treatment
dat_censor <- margot_simulate(
  n = 300,
  waves = 5,
  censoring = list(
    rate = 0.3,
    exposure_dependence = TRUE,
    latent_dependence = TRUE,
    latent_rho = 0.7
  ),
  seed = 999
)
